description: Dive into "Cannes Captured: Iconic Photo Journeys" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Cannes Captured: Iconic Photo Journeys

places.generalDescription: IGY Vieux-Port de Cannes is a charming port nestled in the heart of Cannes, dating back to the 1950s. It is a picturesque setting for boats and luxury yachts, with stunning sailboats and traditional yachts competing in the annual Royal Regatta held in September. The port offers breathtaking views of the old town of Cannes, featuring colorful facades and occasionally vibrant fishing boats. Additionally, it serves as a link between the glamorous Cannes and its authentic counterpart.

sources.snippet: Situ√© au pied du quartier historique du Suquet, le Vieux Port est un lieu embl√©matique du paysage de Cannes. Lien entre le Cannes des paillettes et le Cannes authentique, le Vieux Port de Cannes est un spot parfait pour vos photos Instagram. Depuis cet endroit, vous pouvez prendre en photo toute la vieille ville de Cannes, ses fa√ßades color√©es, son ch√¢teau et parfois les pointus color√©e dans le port.
sources.shortName: Top 5 lieux instagrammables Cannes

sources.snippet: Le Vieux Port de Cannes offre un d√©cor pittoresque avec ses bateaux color√©s et son phare embl√©matique. Au gr√© des saisons, vous pourrez voir des bateaux magnifiques !
sources.shortName: 10 spots instagrammables sur Cannes

places.name: IGY Vieux-Port de Cannes

reviews.text: Small dock but it's really very cute and scenic. Lots of shopping and eateries. Don't book the taxi they are way more expensive then just boiling an excursion on the boat. But local transportation is very accessible. Lots of great views to see. Be careful if pick pockets as its very rampid here. The shopping is amazing here. Lots of things within walking distance. The little train is very thorough and informative.
It really is a harbor full of luxury yachts. For an hour I felt like a diva next to these yachts. They are absolutely gorgeous ‚ù§Ô∏è

This location has been excellent for what we needed.
The facilities are very good and always kept clean.

The port is very well run.

The only issue we had was on the weekend the rubbish collection area seemed to pile up without collection.

But there was a film festival on, so I can blame anyone for that.

On occasion there were shower cubicles with soap dispensers that were not working or empty, but that's only a minor inconvenience.

All in all, it's excellent here.

places.generalDescription: The Palace of Festivals and Congresses of Cannes is a modern convention center that hosts prestigious events like the Cannes Film Festival. Adjacent to it is the historical Church of Lady of Good Voyage, which replaced the original chapel and holds significance as Emperor Napoleon's first stop upon his return from Elba in 1815. Additionally, visitors can enjoy free movie screenings on Mace Plage beach every night, courtesy of Cinema de la Plage.

sources.snippet: One of the most fashionable streets on the French Riviera, this palm-lined boulevard is the center of tourist activity in Cannes. The Boulevard de la Croisette is lined with opulent villas, upscale boutiques featuring the world's most famous luxury brands (Chanel, Dior, Gucci, and Louis Vuitton, among others). Lavish Belle √âpoque hotels, such as the legendary Carlton Cannes, a masterpiece of Art Nouveau architecture designed by Charles Dalmas, along with the equally famous H√¥tel Martinez and the Majestic, are haunts of the rich and famous (and infamous).
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions & Things to Do in Cannes

sources.snippet: The legendary Cannes Film Festival is held every year at the Palais des Festivals in Cannes. Experienced guides in Cannes recommend that vacationers be sure to see the 24 red-carpeted steps and the famous Palais building in person (there‚Äôs a huge casino and the city‚Äôs tourist office inside). You‚Äôll be able to take great photos on the carpet itself.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Cannes in 2024 (Lots of photos)
Capture The Most Photogenic Spots With A Local

places.name: Palace of Festivals and Congresses of Cannes

reviews.text:
Just Visited the Film Festival Venue
There was no entry given
Because
The Film festival is happening in about 2 days
So they were a lot of people doing the pre production works for the festival

Had been there during last September. The Palace of Festival & Congress was under renovation. But the atmosphere around the area is lovely. Try to reach early, say around 9 am. Getting a parking slot in the parking lot of the basement is easier if you reach that time. The crowd also is less. We were able to see a nice market set up around the Prom de La Pantiero. The marina situated in the area is also really good. There are enough eateries in the area where you get lovely croissant and pastries. If the market has been set up you can even get very fresh fruits.

Spent a day in Cannes during the film festival. Great fun, lots of posers, wannabees and neverbees. Not to be missed but realise you are not going to see any of the films as it is entirely by invitation only. The "belle √©poque" architecture is beautiful.

places.address: Palais des Festivals et des Congr√®s, 1 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: March√© Forville is a bustling indoor market located at the base of ancient Le Suquet in Cannes. It offers a wide variety of local produce, flowers, seafood, cheese, and more. The market is open six days a week and transforms into an antiques market on Mondays. Visitors can explore the colorful stalls filled with florists, cheesemongers, fishmongers, bakeries, and other food vendors offering continental delicacies.

sources.snippet: Much of French local life takes place at the market, and Cannes is no exception. Marche Forville is a bustling covered market, housed in a huge Proven√ßal-styled building painted a pinkish ochre colour. Inside you‚Äôll find seemingly endless rows of colourful produce from gleaming piles of black and green olives, huge wheels of French cheeses, profusions of fresh-cut flowers, and shining whole fish.
sources.shortName: Best people-watching spots in Cannes

sources.snippet: The world-famous bazaar can confidently be included in the ‚Äú Best Sights in France‚Äú ranking. Among its regular visitors are both ‚Äúordinary‚Äù citizens and tourists, as well as chefs of the world‚Äôs chain restaurants. Here you can buy any high quality and consistently fresh products: herbs, cheeses, meat of any kind, fish, fruits and vegetables.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Cannes in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: Every morning you can go on a journey through Provence without ever leaving Cannes. All you have to do is visit this covered market, where seasonal produce and regional flavours are sourced from around the south of France. It‚Äôs also favoured by locals, which is grand because glimpses of real everyday life can be rare in this ritzy city.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Cannes (France)

sources.snippet: Si vous souhaitez capturer l‚Äôauthenticit√© de Cannes, rendez-vous au march√© Forville. Ce march√© anim√© est un festin pour les sens, avec ses √©tals color√©s de fruits, de l√©gumes frais, de fleurs et de sp√©cialit√©s proven√ßales. Les couleurs et les textures feront de superbes arri√®re-plans pour vos photos.
sources.shortName: 10 spots instagrammables sur Cannes

sources.snippet: As with most French towns, the food market is still a hub of activity. Come early in the morning to see all the vividly coloured produce, people haggling and leave with some wonderfully fresh fruit to eat as you walk. A post shared by Jennifer Lombardo (@jen_lombardo) on Jan 13, 2019 at 5:27am PST
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Cannes
The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Cannes
How to Explore Cannes Beyond La Croisette

places.name: March√© Forville

reviews.text:
March√© Forville ‚Äì A Gourmet Delight in Cannes

March√© Forville is a fantastic destination for anyone who appreciates fresh, high-quality ingredients and a vibrant market atmosphere. Nestled in the heart of Cannes, this gourmet market offers an incredible selection of local produce, artisanal cheeses, fresh seafood, fragrant herbs, and delicious baked goods.

The variety here is impressive, with vendors showcasing the best seasonal fruits and vegetables, along with an array of cured meats, olives, and regional specialties. Whether you're looking for a quick bite, planning a picnic, or just want to soak in the lively ambiance, this market has something for everyone. The local vendors are passionate and knowledgeable, always happy to share recommendations or offer a taste of their products.

Beyond the food, the market is a cultural experience, reflecting the charm and flavors of the French Riviera. Arrive early to explore the best selections and enjoy the authentic energy of this bustling spot. It is also surrounded by great local restaurants, making it a perfect place to start your culinary adventure in Cannes.

If you get to Cannes, you have to visit this market which is famous. They have very affordable prices and you can find fresh vegetables and fruits. What I liked is that they also have a water fountain where you can wash the vegetables and fruits if you want to eat them. I recommendüíú
Get a real sense of how the locals market and  enjoy some beautiful food, wine and a great atmosphere too!  The passion for quality is absolutely evident on every stall.

places.address: 6 Rue du March√© Forville, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: H√¥tel Martinez - The Unbound Collection by Hyatt is an elegant hotel located on La Croisette in Cannes, offering stunning sea views and a private beach. The hotel features 411 rooms and suites designed with an Art Deco aesthetic, including a penthouse that ranks as one of the largest hotel suites in Europe. Renovated in 2018 by Pierre-Yves Rochon, the property boasts fine dining options and a chic cocktail bar.

sources.snippet: The palace hotels line up like grandees on the other side of the road: the Majestic Hotel; the belle √©poque Carlton Hotel; the more modern JW Marriott Cannes, incorporating the fa√ßade of the former Palais des Festivals, and the art deco Hotel Martinez. Along here also is La Malmaison, a 19th-century mansion-cum-gallery full of contemporary art. It looks classically dignified from outside, and has a fine record of admirable exhibitions.
sources.shortName: The best things to do in Cannes

sources.snippet: First opened in 1929, this hotel maintains that old school sense of glamour while having high end interiors and service. One of the best spots to be during the summer and the big festivals. You‚Äôll find them here
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Cannes

places.name: H√¥tel Martinez - The Unbound Collection by Hyatt

reviews.text:
My boyfriend and I had the most beautiful vacation staying at Hotel Martinez during the week of Bastille Day 2025. The room, location, and food were amazing, but what really stood out the most was the service. From the concierge staff, waitresses, maids, everyone was incredible. This was my first time in France (from USA), and my boyfriend explained that Hotel Martinez and the Carlton, were the top two in Cannes, with Carlton being #1. I can firmly say, our next trip to Cannes must be at Hotel Martinez, and we would not have had the top-notch experience if we were anywhere else, thanks to the staff.

Delphine (if I'm spelling that correctly), made our trip especially magical. After over-hearing us denied from the restaurant because they were closing, she didn't skip a beat and directly guided us to this beautiful bar in the back. She had us seated where we pleased, and the bar was absolutely beautiful. Speakeasy feel, incredible mood lighting and curated art-deco furnishings. Delphine had us served quickly, and when that bar closed, made arrangements for an additional glass of wine - her wine recommendations were stellar. She introduced herself as the new manager of the bar, we thanked her for her exceptional service, and she beautifully described her love for hospitality, and her "why". In LA and Miami, especially at 5 star establishments, the staff often treat guests like they are a burden to even check in or ask for reservations. Not only did we receive exceptional service, but I felt the staff truly enjoyed their work, and made us feel like we were appreciated and wanted as guests. Delphine made our last night of the trip so incredible we both left Hotel Martinez the next morning firmly resolving to return as soon as we could.

There aren't enough words to explain how magical this trip was for us - many thanks to the staff for creating this beautiful memory for us.

The hotel offers exceptional service. The rooms are very up to date and clean, and as a Hyatt Globalist, I was treated very well. The breakfast buffet (and staff) were fantastic. The location in Cannes was great, and their beach club service was top notch.
The concierge, the front desk staff, house keeping, all contributed to an amazing stay. Will return!

I had a fantastic stay at H√¥tel Martinez in Cannes and honestly couldn't have asked for a better experience. From the moment I arrived, the front desk made me feel welcome. They went out of their way to show me different room options so I could choose what I liked best.
The room I chose was spotless, comfortable, and well designed, with a nice balance of elegance and coziness. The whole hotel has a beautiful Art Deco style that gives it so much character, and you can feel the history of the place while still enjoying all the modern comforts.
What really stood out, though, was the service. Every staff member I interacted with was professional, kind, and genuinely seemed to care that guests were having a good time. Nothing ever felt rushed or transactional ‚Äì it was warm and personal.
Overall, everything about my stay felt smooth and effortless, from check-in to check-out. It was one of the most enjoyable hotel experiences I've had in a long time, and I left already looking forward to my next visit.

places.address: 73 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: Perched atop Le Suquet Hill in Cannes, √âglise Notre-Dame d'Esp√©rance, also known as Lady of Hope Church, is a Gothic-style stone church dating back to the early 1600s. This historical landmark offers visitors a serene escape from the bustling city below. The interior boasts a blend of Gothic and Renaissance architecture, adorned with statues and fine wood paneling. Two chapels dedicated to craftsmen's brotherhoods add character to the church's ambiance.

sources.shortName: Where To Go In Cannes To Take Instagram-Worthy Photos

places.name: √âglise Notre-Dame d'Esp√©rance de Cannes

reviews.text: √âglise Notre-Dame d'Esp√©rance in Cannes is a true piece of historic art, standing proudly atop Le Suquet with breathtaking views of the city and sea. The church's charming architecture and serene atmosphere make it an ideal escape from the bustling streets below. Whether you're admiring the intricate details of the interior or enjoying the peaceful courtyard, it's a place where hours pass without even noticing. The tranquil setting makes it perfect for reading, reflecting, or simply taking in the beauty of the surroundings.

What I really love about this church is that you can see the whole city of Cannes and from the bottom, from the bus station to the top, you have to walk slowly for about 20 minutes. It's 100% worth it

Beautiful. Calm. A place to visit in Cannes, especially if you're planning a short walk from the port.

Initiated in 1521, the church's construction spanned over a century, concluding in 1641. It was officially dedicated to Our Lady of Hope on March 25, 1645, coinciding with the Feast of the Annunciation. On my picture you can see the Statue of Our Lady of Hope: A 16th-century gilded wooden statue, donated by the Abbey of L√©rins, stands prominently above the high altar.

places.address: 1 Rue de la Castre, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: Ch√¢teau de la Napoule, originally bought and reconstructed by sculptor Henry Clews in 1918, is now a vibrant arts center and museum. The Musee de la Castre, situated atop Suquet Hill, offers stunning city views and houses a collection of ancient artifacts within its historic castle walls. Visitors can explore the beautiful castle gardens for a small fee or opt for a guided tour of the interior.

sources.snippet: Le Ch√¢teau de Mandelieu-La-Napoule est l‚Äôun des tr√©sors cach√©s de la C√¥te d‚ÄôAzur. Que ce soit sur le long de la jet√©e qui borde la mer ou bien √† l‚Äôint√©rieur du chateau , vous serez fascin√© par les vieilles pierres qui se pr√™te parfaitement √† des photos dignes d‚ÄôInstagram.
sources.shortName: 10 spots instagrammables sur Cannes

places.name: Ch√¢teau de la Napoule

reviews.text: A must visit! Pleasant tour of this beautifully maintained chateau of an American couple. Guided tours at 2:30pm in French so you can enter inside. The tour guide was very helpful and friendly. Unfortunately the second floor is not to be visited since there are artists living there.

Very nice lady at the entrance.
The season of the Castle hasn't begun so the site is only open on Fridays ( so we were really lucky)
Nice view on the sea.
We  came too late to have a guided excursion inside the castle, but the garden was nice too.
The price of the tickets is affordable.

Overall a great experience!

The stunning setting and architecture of this renovated castle is worth the visit. Interpretive signage is in both French and English.

The house tour (French) was interesting and gives you the chance to learn more about the history of the property and see more of Henry Clew's bizarre artwork, if you're into that sort of thing.

The only downside was the garden. While the garden is "pretty", I find it rather horticulturally lacking. It's a shame considering it would be a stunning example of an Arts and Crafts style garden given the proper oversight of a garden curator with trained staff. Hedges and trees have not been properly trimmed in a while, weeds are rampant, the pool is in disrepair and full of algae, the lawns look raggedy, the footpaths need to be weeded, the pergola lacks any sort of interesting climbing flowering interest such as wisteria or laburnum, many borders are left unplanted and are rather filled with weeds, and the few containers that are planted are rather uninspired, featuring just white petunias.

I did notice that there is one area of the garden undergoing renovation (which is accessible only during the house tour), however the garden staff does not seem to be trained in caring for a historic property. They had a pile of dirt directly on one of the historic Arts and Crafts style stone patios, from which they were shoveling directly, no protection covering the patio.

Hiring a head gardener with experience in preserving gardens on historic properties would take this castle to a 5 star visit.

places.generalDescription: La Croisette in Cannes is a glamorous stretch of sidewalk that spans about 1.25 miles along the Mediterranean shoreline. It offers stunning views and is flanked by historic hotels, casinos, restaurants, and gardens. The area exudes charm with its picturesque old town featuring hilly terrain and the medieval Chateau de la Castre at the top, which also houses Musee de la Castre in its iconic tower.

sources.snippet: La Croisette est le spot incontournable pour vos photos Instagram √† Cannes. √âtendue sur 2 kilom√®tres le long du littoral, la Croisette est l‚Äôincarnation du glamour et du chic de la C√¥te d‚ÄôAzur. Depuis l‚ÄôH√¥tel des Orangers, vous atteignez le Boulevard de la Croisette en seulement une dizaine de minutes.
sources.shortName: Top 5 lieux instagrammables Cannes

places.name: La Croisette - Cannes

reviews.text: I'd take a stroll on the  promenade every day! There are vendors along the way too for you to have a sit down with a drink or a snack and looking out the ocean :)  if the sun is out and temperature is high, wearing a hat maybe helpful if you tend to get sunburns, as I didn't find many places with shades.

Went there during the film festival and it was too crowded with people (not in film/fashion business) showing off hoping to be noticed by someone important in the film/fashion business. Liked the car though.
If you enjoy running into celebrities and famous faces, this is definitely the place for you! A hotspot for the well-known, it never disappoints.

places.address: Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: √éle Sainte-Marguerite is a charming small island located just a ferry ride away from Cannes. It boasts beautiful beaches and an ancient fort, offering stunning views of the French Riviera. The island is also home to La Guerite, a renowned establishment since 1902, where visitors can enjoy exquisite dining experiences surrounded by lush Aleppo pine and eucalyptus trees.

sources.snippet: Some 15 minutes offshore from Cannes lie the Iles de L√©rins, two lovely islands, free from bling ‚Äì Ile Ste-Margu√©rite and Ile St-Honorat. For annoying reasons too complex to go into, you cannot take a round trip to both islands and must return to Cannes in between. Ile Ste-Margu√©rite, whose pine and eucalyptus aromas hit you the moment you step off the ferry, is the larger of the two islands, with a handful of small but pricey eateries.
sources.shortName: The best things to do in Cannes

sources.snippet: Just 15 minutes by ferry from Cannes‚Äô old port, √éle Sainte-Marguerite is the closest of the two L√©rins Islands to the mainland. It‚Äôs the perfect option if the beaches and streets of Cannes get a bit much: The island has deep, aromatic forest with stone pines and eucalyptus trees, and even on busy days you can get a little solitude. There‚Äôs historical interest here too: On the north coast is the star-shaped 17th-century Fort Royal, which kept prisoners like the mystery Man in the Iron Mask.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Cannes (France)

sources.snippet: One of four small islands just off the coast of Cannes, this is the perfect place for a half day trip. The air is cooler out here and there are some absolutely ideal swimming spots. A post shared by @priscillia.__ on Jan 20, 2019 at 2:56am PST
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Cannes
The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Cannes
Capture The Most Photogenic Spots With A Local

places.name: √éle Sainte-Marguerite

reviews.text: A great one-day trip destination. A stroll around the island will take you a couple of hours. Highly recommended it outside of high tourist season.
Very nice beaches and if you like to walk around the whole island you will find some very nice spots. Food in one of the two places available was very good.
Pretty place, expect lots of hiking. There are loads of small beaches but they get busy really quickly, I spent the whole day there but I reckon 4/5 hours would be more than enough.

places.generalDescription: Abbaye de L√©rins is an 11th-century monastery located on Saint-Honorat Island, which has been inhabited by monks since the 5th century. The island is also known for its heritage buildings from Lerins Abbey and a Monastery Tower dating back to the 14th century. Today, it is home to 21 Cistercian monks who continue centuries-old traditions of cultivating and producing renowned wines and liqueurs using local methods.

sources.snippet: The old abbey in Saint-Honorat is the perfect place to drop by. Monks have been in the local area for centuries and now, you can visit them in their own home, all 40 acres of it. They produce wine using local methods.
sources.shortName: Where To Go In Cannes To Take Instagram-Worthy Photos

places.name: Abbaye de L√©rins

reviews.text: The island is SO beautiful. Easy boat ride from Cannes. The island is not big but a perfect place to spend a few hours, you can even bring some lunch and have a picnic, just a note that you have to hold on to your trash since you cannot leave any trash on the island so bring an extra bag if you bring snacks or anything. The views and surroundings are so beautiful and very peaceful. They actually have a big outdoor restaurant, we didn't try it but looked decent.

A unique and peaceful place ‚Äì well worth the visit

There isn't much on the island besides the Abbey, but it's absolutely worth seeing. It's a quiet, spiritual place with history. If you're interested in Christianity, history, wine, or just discovering something off the beaten path, this is a fascinating stop.

You might even get the chance to speak with the monks, which adds a meaningful touch to the experience. From an entertainment point of view, there may not be much to "do," but it's a great place to reflect and enjoy the natural beauty ‚Äì including beaches, rocky coastlines, and beautiful views. There's also a restaurant on the island. One important note: there are no trash bins, so you'll need to take any garbage back with you.

Ferries run every hour from Cannes and back, making it very easy to plan a day trip. I definitely recommend visiting

I loved this island more than the main/bigger one. It is quieter, more serene and more beautiful in my opinion. I enjoyed a good hike around the whole island along the ocean. Monks run and maintain the whole place, there's also a shop with their own wine if you fancy something special. Food choices are limited on the island, but I did enjoy a great lunch at the restaurant with ocean view and ocean breeze.

places.generalDescription: The Royal Fort, located on the larger island of Ile Sainte-Margueritte, is a historical fortress built by Vauban. The fort complex includes a museum showcasing Roman relics and the infamous Museum of the Iron Mask. Visitors can also explore the Museum of the Sea, which exhibits archaeological findings from both land and ocean excavations. Additionally, there are prison cells and a church within the fort complex, each with its own unique history.

sources.snippet: Like so many French coastal forts, Fort Royal on the Ile Ste-Margu√©rite wasn‚Äôt much use for defence but proved an admirable prison ‚Äì notably for the Man In The Iron Mask. He was banged up there for 10 years from 1687. Nobody yet is sure who he was.
sources.shortName: The best things to do in Cannes

places.name: Fort Royal de l'√éle Sainte-Marguerite

reviews.text:
Well worth paying for the museum entry with the visit to the fort, the fort itself is free to wander around but it's the museum you have to pay a small amount for, it's in the museum that you get to visit the cells and the place where the man in the iron mask was held.
All information was in both French and English which is fairly rare with French attractions we have found.

Amazing spot when you want to clear up your mind and stay away from busy towns.  Only around 20 minutes from Cannes by ferry and very well priced as well. So beautiful nature on the island will amazed anyone! This is must see spot if you are staying in Cannes.

Definitely worth a day trip. You catch the boat to the Island from Cannes and then walk to the castle. There is a small fee for visiting which gives free access to the museum and the prison. There is a free guided tour, in French though, which in 45 min gives you the entire history of the castle, its Kings and "possesors" and of course it's infamous prisoner "the man with the mask".

places.generalDescription: The Corniche d'Or is a 40 km long road that winds through the stunning Esterel massif, offering breathtaking views of the turquoise Mediterranean Sea. The area is known for its iconic red rocks and hidden coves, making it an ideal spot for nature enthusiasts and those seeking picturesque landscapes. Along the route, travelers can discover beautiful calanques and enjoy splendid sea views.

sources.shortName: Capture The Most Photogenic Spots With A Local

places.name: Corniche d'Or

reviews.text: A stunning drive down the coast
Great views, limited place to park. Nice place to Rest.
It's definitely worth the road trip

places.generalDescription: Church of Our Lady of Good Voyage, located near the Palais des Festivals et des Congres in Cannes, is an intimate 1800s church with Gothic-inspired architecture. It hosts frequent organ and choral concerts, offering visitors a glimpse into local culture. While not as grandiose as some cathedrals, it has a more reachable feel with fairly simple yet impressive architecture. The church also boasts beautiful windows and is considered a worthwhile side trip when exploring seaside Cannes.

sources.snippet: Inside the church, you‚Äôll see majestic 19th-century frescoes and rich gilded wood carvings. The church is considered the oldest and most beautiful in the city. Its building was built in the Gothic Proven√ßal style back in the 17th century.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Cannes in 2024 (Lots of photos)

places.name: Church of Our Lady of Good Voyage

reviews.text: Beautiful church with a great view of Cannes from a high point.
Beautiful little church. The stained glass is beautiful as in most churches. This is a less famous church in Cannes. Worth a visit if you like architecture and the craftsmanship of stained glass.

It's a beautiful church from the outside, located on the Napoleon route to Elba. However, the interior is nothing spectacular. I'm not saying a church must impress with lavish decorations, but the exterior is a bit misleading compared to what you find inside.

sources.snippet: Port Pierre Canto is on the easterly edge of the Croisette and it‚Äôs a great spot to take photos of the harbour and people wearing bling. It‚Äôs one of two ports used in the annual and much-celebrated Cannes Yachting Festival and so, it‚Äôs a great place to snap piccies of those big superyachts. In summer, the nocturnal markets attract a lot of people.
sources.shortName: Where To Go In Cannes To Take Instagram-Worthy Photos

places.name: Port Pierre Canto

reviews.text: Port Pierre Canto is an absolute gem along the French Riviera. The marina is impeccably clean and secure, offering a stunning display of beautiful boats. The waterfront restaurants serve delectable cuisine with picturesque views, complemented by yacht agents who ensure seamless service. The bars and nightclub provide vibrant nightlife options, while the expansive marina offers ample space for leisurely strolls. Port Pierre Canto truly has everything you could ask for in a marina ‚Äì a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and entertainment. Highly recommended!
Beautiful and best place to start your boat journey.

Port Pierre Canto in Cannes is a premier marina known for its excellent facilities and stunning views. It caters to luxury yachts and offers a range of high-end services, including mooring, maintenance, and refueling. The marina is impeccably maintained, with clean, well-organized docks and modern amenities. Its location is ideal, providing easy access to the heart of Cannes and its attractions. The surrounding area features upscale restaurants and boutiques, making it a vibrant spot for both boat owners and visitors. Overall, Port Pierre Canto is a top-notch choice for anyone looking to dock in style while enjoying the charm of Cannes.

places.address: Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: Bd de la Croisette, also known as the Boulevard la Croisette, is a renowned seaside promenade in Cannes. It has a rich history, originally following an ancient seaside road and now famous for hosting events like the Festival International du Film. The boulevard is lined with luxury shops, high-end hotels, and exquisite dining options.

sources.snippet: The famous Croisette ‚Äì the promenade along the coast of Cannes ‚Äì is the perfect place to take wonderful photos, whether it be at sunset or looking back at the smart hotels. What‚Äôs more, when Cannes plays host to the film festival every year, the Croisette is decked out in red, making it the perfect place to feel like a celebrity and have the photos to prove it.
sources.shortName: Where To Go In Cannes To Take Instagram-Worthy Photos

sources.snippet: The splendid La Croisette promenade curving around the bay is the stage for the spectacle that is Cannes. With a sparkling acreage of briny out front and exotic greenery, even ugly people look good. You‚Äôll see beautiful youth, handsome families and over-tanned ladies with brush-head dogs still wearing furs in June (the ladies, that is, not the dogs ‚Äì though‚Ä¶).
sources.shortName: The best things to do in Cannes

sources.snippet: A stroll along the palm-lined Promenade de la Croisette in the summer time is one of the great people-watching experiences on the planet. With grand art deco hotels on one side and splendid superyachts on the other, the Croisette boulevard winds itself along the Mediterranean seafront past the iconic Palais des Festivals, past glamorous boutiques, past the foot of the old town with its cluster of sailboat masts in the port, and finally around to the famous beach clubs stretched along the golden sands. No matter what time you come out, the Croisette is a people-watching extravaganza, but expect the glamour quotient to ramp up on summer nights as the sun sets across the Mediterranean.
sources.shortName: Best people-watching spots in Cannes

sources.snippet: One of the most fashionable streets on the French Riviera, this palm-lined boulevard is the center of tourist activity in Cannes. The Boulevard de la Croisette is lined with opulent villas, upscale boutiques featuring the world's most famous luxury brands (Chanel, Dior, Gucci, and Louis Vuitton, among others). Lavish Belle √âpoque hotels, such as the legendary Carlton Cannes, a masterpiece of Art Nouveau architecture designed by Charles Dalmas, along with the equally famous H√¥tel Martinez and the Majestic, are haunts of the rich and famous (and infamous).
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions & Things to Do in Cannes

sources.snippet: Call it a clich√© but this beach and promenade is the place to see and be seen. It‚Äôs about as posh as it gets; across the Boulevard de la Croisette the luxury fashion houses line up to be counted, and on the shore is a chain of private beaches with fine golden sands. The public beach is furthest to the west, near the Palais des Festivals, and like all of the shore can be heaving with people in mid-summer.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Cannes (France)

sources.snippet: Probably the most well-known area of Cannes, La Croisette is also an unmissable spot for photographers. Its beach, renourished in 2019, is truly superb; the hotel fa√ßades, sunsets, blue deckchairs and even the red steps of the Palais des Festivals will give you beautiful shots. Tip: early risers can enjoy having the location almost to themselves!
sources.shortName: The best of the best instagram spots in Cannes! | C√¥te d‚ÄôAzur France

sources.snippet: Deciding to walk along this landmark in Cannes will eventually take you to the western part of the city. The promenade connecting the new and old ports is about 3 km long. Along the way, you will see plastic blue chairs placed under sprawling pine trees-they are set up for travelers to rest.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Cannes in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: Imagine strolling along the picturesque Croisette or discovering charming alleyways lined with vibrant bougainvillea, all while being guided by a local who knows the best angles and hidden gems of the city.
sources.shortName: Capture The Most Photogenic Spots With A Local

sources.snippet: A walk along here in the summer is one of life‚Äôs great pleasures. Watch the yachts glistening as they arrive into the two ports, stop for an Aperitif, or just sit on one of the benches and people watch.
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Cannes
The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Cannes

places.name: Bd de la Croisette

reviews.text: Among the movie stars! Beautiful boulevard where you can find nice restaurants,fancy boutiques and hotels.The beach is amazing.
Very nice street with shops and restaurants üòÉ

One of the most beautiful cities in Europe that I have visited. It really exudes unusual beauty and romance. The buildings are beautiful and I really like that kind of architecture. Along the coast of Cannes, there are beaches along almost the entire length. They are very clean and it is a real pleasure to swim. Lots of restaurants for every taste and pocket. And of course La Croisette! Beautiful!
I will be happy to visit Cannes again!

places.generalDescription: Nestled on a picturesque hill that offers stunning views of the Bay of Cannes, the Mus√©e des Explorations du Monde is a treasure trove for art and history enthusiasts. Housed in a medieval castle that once served as a monastery for Lerins monks, this museum showcases an impressive array of artifacts ranging from 19th-century Riviera landscape paintings to ethnographic items and musical instruments.

sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions & Things to Do in Cannes

places.name: Mus√©e des explorations du monde

reviews.text: We visited last year. Great museum located at a wonderful spot in the city where you could get great views. Wonderful staff, great exhibitions. Highly recommend!

An old tower museum place to visit up the hill.
Good to go to the top of the tower to see the whole city of 360 degrees.

Charming small museum housed in a small medieval tower with great panoramic views of Cannes. The ethnographic and archaeological collections are interesting but limited in depth. Worth visiting if you are in the area for the view and to explore Le Suquet, but not a destination museum. Best suited for a quick cultural stop.

places.address: 6 Rue de la Castre, 06400 Cannes, France
